meanings.definition: Holding a permanent position, especially as a professor at a university.
meanings.sent1: The tenured professor had a secure job for life.
meanings.sent2: She was excited to become a tenured faculty member at the university.
meanings.sent3: The tenured teacher joked that she would be teaching until she turned into a fossil.
meanings.sent4: His tenured status was like having a golden ticket in the academic world.
meanings.sent5: The concept of being tenured meant he could finally relax and focus on research.

meanings.definition: Having the status of being tenured.
meanings.sent1: The newly tenured employee celebrated with her colleagues.
meanings.sent2: He was proud to have achieved tenured status after years of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The tenured worker playfully declared himself the king of job security.
meanings.sent4: Being tenured felt like reaching the peak of a mountain after a long climb.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of being tenured was like winning a prize for dedication and excellence.
